title: A day in the life of a bronze player.
body:
Tldr; As long as smurfing exists and trolls exists team based mmr is a terrible idea, use the already implemented individual performance tracking systems to dictate lp gain instead, that way people cant just duo with a godlike mate or fluke their way up a tier from getting carried 10 times in a row, itd also soften the blow when you snag a loss and have a really really bad team (less lp loss) its just too logical to not do that, why has it not happened, i get the whole "if it aint broke dont fix it" but barely working by the skin of its teeth is still not broke, doesnt mean it shouldnt be improved.

Carried myself to 6 out of 10 wins today

1 of those games is my fault

2 of those games i had to lane against a diamond smurf elo boosting his mate (fucking smurfs)

and the last game i had a raka whos sole mission was to try and get 0/30 that game, she almost did it, yes i had to try and carry that.

I can guarantee you right now, those 3 games dropped my mmr enough that the other 6 games dont matter in in my overall mmr gain, sure my winrate went up but my mmr sure didnt.

The worst part? you cant stop it, the report system doesnt work so the trolls can do as they please without repercussions, and even if they do get banned im not getting my mmr back, and smurfs are perfectly legal but completely break the entire purpose of the mmr system in the first place, if a rando diamond player can just boost his mate to a tier he shouldn't be in and rape my ass and push me to a lower tier (once again one i shouldnt be in), than whats the point of mmr in the first place (yet another reason to stop using mmr for a team based game, use fucking individual performance scoring already, youve proved you can do it with champ masteries)

And before you elitist pricks say "well if you dont belong there you will climb"

Sure, but lets be real here, you dont grind your mmr from trash to decent in one afternoon, you win 5 games, and get 4 losses for random reasons out of your control, then you might lose 1 or 2 games because you actually got outplayed, the end result is you have -1 wins and you have to try extra hard the next day and pray to the rng gods that you dont have a single troll for your 10 games or your absolutely raped in mmr, repeat the cycle because rngesus doesnt care about your elo climb and suddenly you find that without a lucky streak what looks like 30 wins is actually -5 in mmr terms

Now you are actually worse off from where you started, even though your winrate says otherwise.

Basically sure you can win 20/20 games that week, but if you have 20 losses worth of mmr loss from a month ago that you havnt made up yet well you still havnt gained back any of the mmr you started with, infact youve gained back less mmr for the 20 wins than you lost for the 20 losses, basically you cannot afford to lose, ever, to climb you need a 100% win ratio down here or close to or you are fucked, because that loss you just had from 0/30 raka is gonna catch up with you in a couple days.

To put it simply, it takes a month to gain like 100mmr, unless you A) have a mate boost you, B) get lucky and have a clean streak with no trolls at all (doesnt even have to be no trolls on your team, i mean no trolls at all its still more fair than having a troll on your team regardless) or C) just stop caring about mmr play the game and bring down the people around you trying to improve with your "pfft its only bronze" attitude"

replies.body:
You have a x/4 chance of getting trolls on your team. The enemy has x/5 chance. You have a x/4 chance to get a smurf , your enemy team has a x/5 chance. There is no "random" , just good players and bad. Bad game streaks happen, for everyone. The difference between players that climb and players that stay in elo hell is attitude. If you're prone to tilt from "random" troll and smurfs then you will stay low ranked.

Just play the game, enjoy the plays you make. Don't worry about others.

Sure but theres one problem with that mentality.

If i win a game, get mmr get paired against the same team (my elo is reallllllly low so we have a huge mmr spread across a small number of players) only this time i have a troll, i now lose more mmr than i gained because my mmr is higher than my opponents by a fair margin, i now have less mmr than before and finally drop an mmr bracket so i get paired with new opponents and teammates, now when i do get a win i will gain less mmr than the troll made me lose, in the span of 3 games despite winning 2 of them i have lost mmr.

That is what i am complaining about, its not that trolls make me lose, its that they make me play more games than i should have to to get exactly the same results.

Basically smurfs and trolls turn this game into an mmr grind, instead of a well you know, game.

on that note if you want proof that it doesnt work that way go check out my match history, the last 3 ranked games? trolling ashe (who i got really pissed at hence the custom games) trolling team (they just danced in dragon pit and fed) and lastly diamond 5 smurf yasuo botlane

3 games, 3 losses, all 3 losses involved trolls and or smurfs.

Where are your statistics and probabilities now.

3 games is not a large enough sample size to prove anything. If its tilting you that hard, don't play ranked.

edit: I looked at your match history. Your Mordekaiser build says it all. No double runic totem start? Nashors? Why not Rylais? I don't think Morde is even strong atm, for low rank players if you have to adc just play Cait, even if its into a "counter" like Sivir.

Stop pointing the finger at others and focus on yourself.

6 games including yesterday*
I wasnt meant to go adc that game i panick picked morde so gl judging based on a literal mistake.

And the build for that game was me saying "fuck it the games over anyway"
Mistaken panick do and should be judged. You get so long to pick a champ.

Cool tell me that when you have to wait 30 seconds for someone to tell you what lane they are going and you get exactly 1 second to pick a champion, your fucking pathetic mate, desperately picking at the argument for ways to insult me, grow up.

I remember trying to explain why elo hell doesnt exist to you a while ago. I see you still have the same attitude lol...

If it is taking you a month to gain 100 mmr, then let it take a month. If you truly deserve to raise your rank, then it'll happen eventually. You can't possibly argue with that

I got out of bronze (knocking on door of s2 preseason ) but i do sympathise. My experience has been  that getting out of low bronze has been harder and more frustrating than climbing from b1 to s4. B5 is a river you are stuck in. B4 are rocks where you can see hand holds but the rocks are slippery and brittle - you know what YOU have to do but environmental factors make the climb very difficult.  B2 is when you are clear of the slippery rocks, b1 is when the rocks dont snap off, and from s1 it is up to you to climb based on your awareness of the best path.

But i strongly feel that a version of elo hell does exist - not impossible to climb out of but very very difficult when your team mates are potatoes.

^ literally what im saying, i KNOW that i can get out of bronze, its the time factor that pisses me off, at the current rate that my winrate is creeping up (my elo is so low that 90% of the playerbase are either school kids, have shit net, or are trolls and smurfs, im not kidding probably 10% of the playerbase are over the age of 18 and actually give a damn and yes i can attribute school kids in my rant because my winrate goes down during school holidays and goes up when kids are at school so weather they are tilting me or just bringing me down they do affect me in some way) I probably wont see silver until s7 or late s6 at the earliest.

Like sometimes i wish id never found out that league uses an mmr system, so i could be blissfully ignorant and just keep basing my worth on lp because then i could actually feel good when i shoot from b5 to b1 instead of thinking "great now im gonna get like 5lp per win because my mmr is still trash"

You still die SOOO much bro. Like, seriously. You will climb faster if you focus on improving your death rate..

edit - You also have super static builds. You seem to build exactly the same every single game, regardless of team compositions.
A Rylai's Scepter may not be the best option vs Lee, Ez, Kat, Leona, Riven for example

again mate, clearly arguing out of context, i run rylais on morde, specifically to stop people fucking running away, on a lee? fair dinkum hes gonna get away, the other 4 people though still works dont it *gasp* maybe i build for general situations instead of "hmmm they have one champion on their team, better change my build so it only works on them and fucks me for the other 4 team members"

and secondly improve my death rate? cool what scripts do you run to not die? oh teamwork scripts? yeah im bronze we dont have those, i have to rely on myself and only myself, as a result i tend to get picked out for cc and raped by 2-3 people because of say blitz knockup, xin knockup, annie stun, malph ult, you know unavoidable cc, how do you not die from that stuff? oh  thats simple, you dont get close to them, oh right i forgot, i mostly play melee champs fucking retarded me, ok so obviously the solution is to have my team help me yeah? oh wait yeah, my teams all jacking it to the sounds of their own keyboard because they are bronze, i forgot again.

Ok ok i got an idea, how about i use scripts to somehow disable said cc, and then i wont get stunlocked yeah thatl work, itl also get me banned.

Or heres the best idea yet, dont fucking criticize without A) context, or B) providing fucking constructive advice, what part of "die less" helps me get better, yeah thats right, it doesnt because fucking no duh i should die less, what i need is the how, not the what. now fuck off back to your elitist little hidey hole and let the non toxic people talk.
Another piece of advice mate, people might take you seriously if you stop approaching them like they are retards.

On a scale of Crumbzz to Faker, Crumbzz being garbage and Faker being Faker, my mechanics are like Crumbzz level and I managed to climb from Bronze to Silver **three separate times** last year. I kept jumping back down because my net is spastic as and I kept dcing in Silv 5 for some reason, without being too arrogant, if I had stable net, I honestly think I'd be real close or in Gold V, I kept dcing in high S2 :'(. Anyway, it's not hard man, just focus each and every game, don't play lazily and you'll be sweet.

Im not saying its not possible, ive climbed from b5 to b1 then dropped to b5 then back to b1 multiple times in season 5 so i know its possible for me to escape bronze, its the time factor im complaining about.

Basically because of some stupid mistakes i made when this account was created combined with the rng factor of this game, i can never expect to get a 100% winrate, my net could be shaky, any of the 9 other players could be shaky (this could artificially increase or decrease my winrate causing inaccuracies in my mmr)

Its just a really big case of 2 steps forward 3 steps back, only the steps are games, and the steps back generally tend to be due to environmental factors.

I play this game not as 5v5, its 1v9, for that very reason.
